dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: No! No more listening. No more preaching. We are losing people left and right. We need to act!

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Enough, Zora. I'm not putting the torch to innocent people. Do you want to bring the Board's cruisers and gunships down on us?

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: Captain. Apologies, but our situation grows dire. Our people talk of... foolish endeavors. What news do you bring?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If there are gunships, they sure didn't stop me from landing here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: The printing press is all yours.

dialog.speaker: graham_bryant (Male)
dialog.utterance: They are armed all the same. All they need is a good reason, and war is one such reason.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Okay. Well, the printing press is all yours.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Is that what you're arguing about? Going to war with someone?

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Did you find the Van Noys?

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: We're out of time. We need food and ammunition. We need to hit Stellar Bay while we still have the manpower to do it.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You want to attack the city?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Are they really doing better than you are?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I see. Listen, I've been to the printing press. It's clear.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Yes. I know it's drastic, but... it's clear that Sanjar will never cooperate. And if it's him or us, I choose us.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Doubtful. But we don't need much, and Sanjar isn't going to share.
